snippet: The last time an N.B.A. conference had only two teams with winning records at this point in the season was in 1972.
abstract: Eastern Conference of the NBA has only two of fifteen teams with records above .500; last time a conference had only two teams with winning records through Nov 30 was 1972-73 when the East had just eight teams; in contrast the Western Conference, which for more than a decade has often been stronger overall than the East, has 10 teams with winning records
lead_paragraph: The last time an N.B.A. conference had only two teams with winning records at this point in the season was in 1972.

headline.main: Eastern Conference Sets New Standards for Poor Play
headline.print_headline: Eastern Conference Sets New Standards for Poor Play
